  • Vector Support

Vector Support

ProtoBase provides a lightweight Vector type and an exact in-memory vector index suitable as a fallback for similarity search.

Vector

class proto_db.vectors.Vector(data, dim, normalized=False)[source]

Simple immutable vector wrapper. - data: list of float32-like values (stored as Python floats). - dim: dimension (validated against data length). - normalized: whether data was L2-normalized (for cosine).

Zero-copy buffers

  • from_buffer(buf, dtype=’float32’, copy=’auto’|’true’|’false’)

  • as_buffer() -> memoryview

  • as_numpy(copy: bool | None = None)

static from_buffer(buf, dtype='float32', copy='auto')[source]

Create a Vector from a buffer (bytes, bytearray, memoryview, or numpy array if available). copy semantics:

  • ‘false’: never copy; requires C-contiguous, little-endian float32; otherwise raises.

  • ‘auto’: no copy if compatible; else copy once.

  • ‘true’: always copy into Python floats.

Parameters:

  • dtype (str)

  • copy (str)

Return type:

Vector

as_buffer()[source]

Return a read-only memoryview of float32 little-endian values (copy once).

Return type:

memoryview

as_numpy(copy=None)[source]

Return a numpy array representation of the vector. - copy=False or None: return a NumPy array with dtype float32. Implementation may copy for safety. - copy=True: always return a new independent ndarray.

Parameters:

copy (bool | None)

__init__(data, dim, normalized=False)
Parameters:

  • data (tuple[float, ...])

  • dim (int)

  • normalized (bool)

Return type:

None

Parameters:

  • data (tuple[float, ...])

  • dim (int)

  • normalized (bool)

Utility Functions

  • cosine_similarity(a, b): compute cosine similarity between iterables of floats.

  • l2_distance(a, b): compute Euclidean distance between iterables of floats.

Vector Indexes

class proto_db.vector_index.VectorIndex[source]

Abstract vector index interface. Concrete implementations may be ANN structures (e.g., HNSW) or exact.

abstractmethod search(query, k, metric=None, params=None)[source]

Return list of (id, score). For cosine: score is similarity; for l2: negative distance.

Parameters:

  • query (Vector | Iterable[float])

  • k (int)

  • metric (str | None)

  • params (dict | None)

Return type:

List[Tuple[Any, float]]

class proto_db.vector_index.ExactVectorIndex(metric='cosine')[source]

Simple exact index using in-memory dictionary. Suitable as a correctness fallback when ANN libs are unavailable.

Optimized for batch queries when NumPy is available.

Parameters:

metric (str)

search(query, k, metric=None, params=None)[source]

Return list of (id, score). For cosine: score is similarity; for l2: negative distance.

Parameters:

  • query (Vector | Iterable[float])

  • k (int)

  • metric (str | None)

  • params (dict | None)

Return type:

List[Tuple[Any, float]]

class proto_db.vector_index.HNSWVectorIndex(metric='cosine', M=16, efConstruction=200, efSearch=64)[source]

HNSW-based ANN index using hnswlib (optional dependency). - Supports cosine and l2 metrics. - Maintains soft-deletes via mark_deleted; exposes tombstone count; provides rebuild(). - Persists index and id mapping via save(path_prefix) / load(path_prefix).

Parameters:

  • metric (str)

  • M (int)

  • efConstruction (int)

  • efSearch (int)

search(query, k, metric=None, params=None)[source]

Return list of (id, score). For cosine: score is similarity; for l2: negative distance.

Parameters:

  • query (Vector | Iterable[float])

  • k (int)

  • metric (str | None)

  • params (dict | None)

Return type:

List[Tuple[Any, float]]

rebuild()[source]

Rebuild the index to drop tombstoned items and compact structure.

Return type:

None

Notes on backends

  • HNSWVectorIndex requires the optional ‘hnswlib’ (and numpy) dependency. If it is not available, it transparently falls back to the exact implementation.

  • HNSW supports parameters M, efConstruction and efSearch. Use save(path_prefix)/load(path_prefix) to persist and reload the index and its metadata (id mapping, metric, params).

Operators

The query system recognizes a similarity-threshold operator for linear evaluation:

  • near[]: match records whose vector field is near a query vector above a threshold for cosine (or within a distance threshold for l2).

Example:

# Filter records with cosine similarity >= 0.8 to query vector
expr = Expression.compile(['emb', 'near[]', [1.0, 0.0, 0.0], 0.8])
plan = WherePlan(filter=expr, based_on=base_plan, transaction=tr)
out = list(plan.execute().as_iterable())

Notes

  • This phase provides a correctness baseline (linear evaluation). Future phases can attach ANN indexes (e.g., HNSW) to collections and enable pushdown.

Vectors

Vector

class proto_db.vectors.Vector(data, dim, normalized=False)[source]

Simple immutable vector wrapper. - data: list of float32-like values (stored as Python floats). - dim: dimension (validated against data length). - normalized: whether data was L2-normalized (for cosine).

Zero-copy buffers

  • from_buffer(buf, dtype=’float32’, copy=’auto’|’true’|’false’)

  • as_buffer() -> memoryview

  • as_numpy(copy: bool | None = None)

static from_buffer(buf, dtype='float32', copy='auto')[source]

Create a Vector from a buffer (bytes, bytearray, memoryview, or numpy array if available). copy semantics:

  • ‘false’: never copy; requires C-contiguous, little-endian float32; otherwise raises.

  • ‘auto’: no copy if compatible; else copy once.

  • ‘true’: always copy into Python floats.

Parameters:

  • dtype (str)

  • copy (str)

Return type:

Vector

as_buffer()[source]

Return a read-only memoryview of float32 little-endian values (copy once).

Return type:

memoryview

as_numpy(copy=None)[source]

Return a numpy array representation of the vector. - copy=False or None: return a NumPy array with dtype float32. Implementation may copy for safety. - copy=True: always return a new independent ndarray.

Parameters:

copy (bool | None)

__init__(data, dim, normalized=False)
Parameters:

  • data (tuple[float, ...])

  • dim (int)

  • normalized (bool)

Return type:

None

Parameters:

  • data (tuple[float, ...])

  • dim (int)

  • normalized (bool)

Notes

  • Supports zero-copy buffer bridging via from_buffer()/as_buffer()/as_numpy().

  • Default dtype float32 little-endian for buffer interop.
